text: Get this figure at the BigBadToyStore link in the description
"Reee!"
Hey my name is jobby, and today we're taking a look at a round boi, yes your also indeed a round boi
but we're not talking about you, get out, the ocular max omne is a third party
Representation of the transformers generation one character named cosmos and according to his bio on tf wiki: insert kejv joke in picture caption here
"the cosmos is also within us, we are made of star..."
And this little butterball transforms into an adorable little
UFO so before we get into it, I should mention that my particular copy of the figure did not arrive in a box, this guy
Was actually an early production sample sent to me directly from ocular max
Themselves and I recieved the way before was in stock, so to them my apologize for the extreme delay
PLEASE DON'T SUE ME, the painting and the sculpting on this figure is pretty good. I mean
It's nothing spectacular, but that's pretty much
How all transformers generation 1 designs were their blocky exceedingly simple
But they've got that kind of charm that keeps getting suckers like me to keep buying merch
what can I say I love transformers, and on the topic of charm my god is this thing C U TE
I mean it barely even looks like a vehicle. It's just a tiny glorified hockey puck
but when we take a closer look at the figure. You can definitely see that it is indeed a vehicle
It's got some landing gear thrusters on the back and even a cockpit which reveals a very nicely sculpted bumblebee
And there's even more of that cockpit when you look at the front of the figure, or is this the back
Is this the front ? I don't know anymore  you're gonna need something to pry this open which kind of sucks
ehe- and God diggity damn its blaster, and if you don't know who blaster is, I barely even know him either
Blaster: "Heh i'm have been waiting a long time for this..."
" You poor excuse for a sound system"
Soundwave: "ALL TALK NO SHOCK"
So not only does this guy look cute
He feels
Cute too- I don't even know what that means, what I'm saying is that he's nice to hold and he's got a really nice weight
To him and that's due to some diecast metal pieces which of course I found through my *moan*, and for the most part this mode holds
together really well
But there is this one tab that refuses to go in all the way
I have to assume this problem was fixed in the final release, and there's a problem then not even a final release can fix
I'm not a fan of these gaps. I mean it's not the end of the world but come on
It was almost the perfect circle, and as you can see here
There's virtually no kibble on this guy which is amazing. So why don't we move on to his accessories
There are no accessories, at least not with this production sample according to the instructions you get
two mini cannon so I have to assume again that they're included in the final release, but you do get these two cannons
Which you can easily
*struggling*
AHHHHHHHHHH
Not easy at all to get these things out
*more struggling*
AHH F U C K
*orgasm*
That looks pretty cool and adorably non-threatening
these things are also made out of metal which of course I found out (random non-sense), but there's really no point of talking
About the possibility of a goddamn dumpling, so we could just move on to the size comparison
Here's figma Madoka kaname, S.H. monsterarts Godzilla, Masterpiece Optimus Prime, and another transformable round boi, the masterpiece Bumblebee
wait how does this guy fit into here just don't question it, and its no surprise that this guy transforms
So we should just get into that, you simply push this button
*Micheal bay like explosion* "THE COSMOS IS ALSO WITHIN US, WE ARE MADE OF STAR STUFF"
*royalty free jazz*
And here we have his robot mode, and as you can see it's very faithful to the original g1 drawing
Just uhh, not as round
He is still short and stocky, but he significantly slimmed down, which makes him look a bit cooler
and I gotta admit the robot mode was pretty off-putting at first
I'm just so used to my transformers figures vaguely resembling muscle men
But after having this figure for about what is it now two months again? Sorry for the delay?
Please don't sue me I've gotten used to these proportions, so this robot mode holds together extremely well
But there's a little part of the arm. Did break on me
This is no slide against the figure itself it might just be due to my own incompetence
See I might have pulled it back to hard and there you go
but a problem like that is easily fixable with superglue and it's still functional
He also feels really nice to hold you to that diecast metal which in this mode is located on his feet
It's kind of a common thing with masterpiece style transformers
and a really cool detail that I'd noticed so the design on this chest here is a big version of the cockpit of the
vehicle mode, so by way of simple transformation engineering this guy managed to pull off mass shifting
and at this point I would have talked about accessories, if it had any......
but the thrusters of the vehicle mode do become these arm cannon, and one of the landing gears of the vehicle mode becomes
*insert dick joke here*
so for such a short stocky piece of shit
this guy is actually quite POSEABLE
ball-joint at the head, can look up very far, and look down very far *chuckle*
Rotation at the arm, arm moves out, double bend at the elbow, bicep swivel, wrist swivel, and all his fingers are on
Individual hinge joints and it's kind of hard to get out there, thumb is on a ball-joint
and on his index finger has a middle hinge-joint, forward movement at the shoulder, but it can't really move back that far
*SWIVEL HERE*
AB crunch, and this little flap moves to accommodate that, rotation at the leg and that's on a beautiful ratchet
side skirts move out allows for it. YES . thigh swivel, landing gear can
*more dick jokes*
Double bend at the knee, ankle moves up, and you get a beautiful pivot, this guy has an incredible amount of joints
But due to the awkward nature of his proportions the poses that you can get with them are kind of limited the arms are especially
Awkward, but you can still manage to get some dynamic poses out of him
Madoka, Godzilla, Prime, Bumblebee
over all this thing is awesome
*Godzilla kiss* "aah"
Yes, the blocky and simple nature of the design might not be for everyone
But if your into that g1 stuff, which is totally not outdated, definitely get this figure and for a third party figure
it's actually a pretty good prize at the.......
